content:
With reference to ONC Interoperability Rule around 21st Century’s Cure’s Act, all Healthcare IT vendors would open access of data to Patients.
• Is there any EHR allowing access to the information to patients?
• Is there a layer for getting patient authorized and access APIs to fetch patient information using FHIR standard?
• How a patient can get credential?
• Is there a developer environment to test and build patient centric applications?
The answers to those questions will vary somewhat by EHR. @Jenni Syed @Danielle Friend @Jeffrey Danford
@RAHUL GOEL I believe you posted on our google group - let us know if you have additional questions!
The ONC has a searchable list of all certified system with links to their documentation at https://chpl.healthit.gov/#/collections/api-documentation
@Jenni Syed Yes I did posted and thanks for the response, I was exploring for other EHR if they have this facility

Allscripts supports patient access for all its products. The majority use a FHIR DSTU2 API. Patients can create their credentials and are granted access by invitation from the provider system. Development environments and documentation can be found at https://developer.allscripts.com.
